adventure_overview: In partnership with the Barbara Sinatra Children’s Center Foundation, Lions will learn about the “Protect Yourself Rules” and other skills needed to stay safe. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: With permission from your parent or legal guardian watch the Protect Yourself Rules video for the Lion rank.

activities.name: Protect Yourself Rules Video Lion
activities.description: Watch the Protect Yourself Rules video with your parent or legal guardian.

requirements.text: With your Lion adult partner, demonstrate Shout, Run, Tell as explained in the Protect Yourself Rules video.

activities.name: Shout, Run, Tell Relay Lion
activities.description: Cub Scouts demonstrate their own personal way of shout, run, and tell.

requirements.text: With your Lion adult partner, demonstrate how to access emergency services.

activities.name: Home Security Emergency Services
activities.description: At home learn how to contact emergency services using a home alarm or voice-activated devices.

requirements.text: With your Lion adult partner, demonstrate how to safely cross a street or walk in a parking lot.

activities.name: Green Means Go Red Means Stop
activities.description: Play a game of red light, green light to reinforce how to safely cross a street.

activities.name: Make Believe Parking Lot
activities.description: Set up a mock crosswalk and parking lot for Cub Scouts to learn about staying safe in these situations.
